image.altText: A paramedic opens the hatch of an ambulance

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Aboriginal man who died after being restrained by police in Alice Springs was from the remote community of Yuendumu.

title.children: NT major crimes unit investigates 24yo Yuendumu man's death in custody

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: An engineering report has revealed 11 massive fuel tanks built unlawfully on Darwin Harbour for the US military are not designed to withstand a category three cyclone.

title.children: US military fuel tanks in Darwin not built to withstand major cyclone

image.altText: A truck drives out of the entrance of the Darwin Port on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: An American investment firm linked to US President Donald Trump's administration has shown interest in the Port of Darwin, which is currently leased by a Chinese-owned company.

title.children: US company linked to Trump administration in talks over Darwin Port

image.altText: A group of Indonesian men wearing medical face masks walking out of court, all wearing navy blue pants and white sneakers.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory judge said he needed to "send a message" to illegal fishers, while fining 18 Indonesian nationals more than $80,000 for fishing in Australian waters.

title.children: NT judge fines group of illegal foreign fishers more than $80,000

image.altText: The facade of the Darwin Private Hospital

props.synopsis: Healthscope has moved to quell fears the Northern Territory could lose its only private hospital, as financial troubles cast doubt over the medical centre's future.

title.children: Healthscope insists 'business as usual' at the NT's only private hospital

image.altText: A woman sitting on a verandah and smiling.

props.synopsis: Sue Roman was one of hundreds of children taken from the notorious Darwin mission Retta Dixon and sent across the country to work as a servant.

title.children: Forced into slavery at 12, Sue Roman brought a royal commission to Darwin

image.altText: A man sitting at a conference table inside an office, in front of a large window, clasping his hands and looking serious.

props.synopsis: A workplace investigation into the NT's former corruption watchdog has found he gave "special and/or unwelcome attention to female employees".

title.children: 'A thing for pretty girls': NT ICAC workplace probe findings released

image.altText: Bulldozer Lee Point

props.synopsis: A Commonwealth-owned defence housing company has been fined more than $18,000 for unlawfully clearing land at a popular birdwatching area on the outskirts of Darwin.

title.children: Defence Housing Australia fined for unlawful land clearing at Lee Point

image.altText: Two people kneel at the base of a tree.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs Town Council has apologised for removing a roadside memorial to a teenager without consulting his family or friends.

title.children: 'Beyond heartbreaking' removal of roadside memorial angers family

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: A police detective is giving evidence in murder trial of Erin Patterson, who is accused of deliberately poisoning four relatives with a meal containing death cap mushrooms, killing three. Follow the hearing in our live blog.

title.children: Police evidence to continue in Erin Patterson murder trial

image.altText: A smiling teenage girl with long, dark hair.

props.synopsis: Police say the Good Night Scrub National Park is not the only area of interest in their investigation into the 17-year-old's disappearance.

title.children: Police suspend bushland search for missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting in the Kremlin wearing a black suit

props.synopsis: US president President Donald has become increasingly frustrated with his Russian counterpart over his actions in Ukraine, lashing out at him for the second time this week.

title.children: Trump warns Putin he is 'playing with fire' over Ukraine

image.altText: a young woman wearing a hijab and glasses walks past a group of journalists

props.synopsis: The independent senator for WA says she made a formal complaint that was escalated to the Parliamentary Workplace Support Service.

title.children: Senator discloses 'inappropriate' behaviour by senior parliamentary colleague

image.altText: A man looks to up, to the side and out of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle has faced the heavy price of being a whistleblower in Australia. It's time for urgent reforms of public and private sector whistleblower laws and the establishment of a new body to protect those who blow the whistle.

title.children: 'Richard Boyle is a superhero': So why didn't whistleblower laws protect him?

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: Detectives say seven males aged between 15 and 21 have been arrested and charged over an allegedly planned gang fight with machetes at Northland shopping centre on Sunday.

title.children: Seven young males involved in 'planned' gang fight at Northland, police allege

image.altText: A house on fire in Croydon

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for help to find a 50-year-old man after a person's remains were found in the ashes of a house fire in Sydney's inner west this morning.

title.children: 'Suspicious' Sydney house fire leaves one dead, resident at large

image.altText: Two police officers stand under a sign that says "ambulance" at the entrance to a hospital.

props.synopsis: A man thought to be armed is believed to be travelling in a vehicle with fake number plates in the regional Queensland town of Kingaroy.

title.children: Police fear gunman on loose after reports of shots in Kingaroy

image.altText: Sussan Ley in press conference

props.synopsis: It's not all that long since Labor had its own dragging, painful, exhausting split over an issue on which its opponents were jubilantly united.

title.children: Before the Coalition was so divided on climate, Labor had its own splits

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Liberal MP Moira Deeming has told John Pesutto she may go after his financial backers if he cannot pay her legal costs.

title.children: Liberal MP says she may pursue former leader's backers for court costs

image.altText: Rhiannon DV Interview

props.synopsis: Rhiannon Purcell is fighting to extend an ADVO against her ex-husband — and she claims NSW Police and the courts have only let her down.

title.children: Victim-survivor fighting for her safety after her perpetrator's release from jail

image.altText: A collection of red rocks on Western Australia's Burrup Peninsula, featuring an ancient engraving of a Goanna.

props.synopsis: A leading scientist expresses "grave concern" about "unacceptable interference" in a major study of the impacts of industrial emissions on ancient Aboriginal rock carvings.

title.children: Gagged scientist speaks out over WA government's claims in rock art report

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen ahead of the latest ABS inflation figures and a likely interest rate cut by the Reserve Bank of New Zealand. Wall Street surges on US President Donald Trump's decision to delay a proposed tariff hike on European Union imports. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rises, Wall Street surges on Donald Trump's EU tariff delay

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Myer and Web Travel shares jump after well-received trading updates
ASX rises 0.5 per cent in early trade
Wall Street rebounds on belief Trump will not 'drive us over the cliff'

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of a man

props.synopsis: A former aide to Sean "Diddy" Combs testifies the hip-hop mogul threatened to kill her during her first day on the job and waved a gun as he kidnapped her years later in an angry rush to find and kill rapper Kid Cudi.

title.children: Diddy's ex-employee says she was kidnapped in rap mogul's plot to kill Kid Cudi

image.altText: A red and white passenger ferry docked in a bay with the blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Both of Tasmania's brand new Bass Strait ferries have "technical issues" with their LNG systems and their departure for Australia will be delayed, the government has said.

title.children: New problems with Spirit ferries delay arrival in Tasmania again

image.altText: Generic hospital equipment in a patient's room.

props.synopsis: Imported IV fluids containing as much as 12 times more air than those made in Australia are posing a heightened air embolism risk in emergencies for clinicians to manage.

title.children: Air inside imported IV fluid bags is posing an extra risk in emergencies

image.altText: An aerial shot of boat on water next to a sand bank

props.synopsis: A remote beach in WA offers a glimpse into the severity of plastic pollution in the world's oceans.

title.children: This WA beach looks pristine until you scratch the surface

image.altText: Three children crouch in long grass and smile

props.synopsis: The new faces of Harry Potter and his friends Ron and Hermione have been revealed.

title.children: Three newcomers cast as leads for Harry Potter reboot series

image.altText: A woman looking at a Broome rental map

props.synopsis: A rental advocacy group in Western Australia's north calls for tighter regulations on tenancy applications, amid an increase in scams targeting people searching for a home online.

title.children: 'All you see is fake': Rental scams on the rise on social media

image.altText: A large crowd of people walking

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says it has fired warning shots outside a newly opened aid centre in Gaza to control Palestinians rushing in for food.

title.children: Israeli troops fire warning shots as Palestinians crowd aid centre

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate winning the State of Origin series

props.synopsis: It has been three decades since Paul Vautin's miracle Maroons pulled off the greatest upset in State of Origin history, and the story of Queensland's unlikeliest heroes shows no signs of slowing down.

title.children: 'We get brainwashed': The miracle win underpinning Queensland Origin cult

image.altText: Tina Lombardo

props.synopsis: Nearly four years after Australia's multi-billion-dollar cosmetic surgery industry sparked outrage and was subjected to long overdue reforms, the sector hasn't done enough work.

title.children: 'Staff too fearful to speak out': Cosmetic surgery sector is a work in progress

image.altText: First Nations woman, Kath Ryan, stands in front of WA Parliament House.

props.synopsis: More than 60 years ago, Kath Ryan was pulled screaming from her family in WA's Gascoyne region. Since then she's overcome adversity, reconnected with her mother and become a proud grandparent.

title.children: 'People need to know': Stolen Generations survivor reflects on 'great sadness'

image.altText: Conceptual paper illustration of human hands handling DNA in a lab dish.

props.synopsis: Scientists have used personalised gene-editing therapy to successfully treat a baby with a rare genetic condition. Could this technique help to unlock treatments for others?

title.children: World-first CRISPR gene therapy could 'transform' treatment for rare diseases

image.altText: A crowd of people walking across the harbour bridge

props.synopsis: The Council for Aboriginal Reconciliation planned a symbolic march across the Sydney Harbour Bridge in May 2000. About a quarter of a million people turned up.

title.children: As a symbol for reconciliation in 2000, the Bridge Walk exceeded expectations
